■ Very Good.
U. F. Goodall
Chief, Audio-Visual Education
Department of Public Instruction
State of Pennsylvania
■ Excellent!
C. Chandler, Jr.
Central Hudson Gas and Electric Corporation
Poughkeepsie, New York
■ Excellent for TV.
W. W. Wimberly
Director, Audio-Visual Education
El Paso Public Schools
■ Very fine productions ...
E. F. Campbell
Wisconsin Public Service Corporation
■ Good Teaching films.
F. W. Summers
Kingsport Public Library
■ The work is creditable indeed ...
J. B. Shores
Director, Employee—Public Relations
The Texas and Pacific Railway Company
■ Well produced educational films.
Harvey Pergament
Cavalcade Television Programs
■ We think you have done a wonderful
production job.
Katherine B. Zimmerman
Division of School Savings
Rochester Savings Bank
■ We screened the films before six of our execu¬
tives and immediately decided we could put
them to good use.
D. C. Wester
Director, Employee-Public Relations
Kentucky Utilities Company
■ The film (Our Two Great Documents) was
discussed by the more serious students as a
“must” addition to our library,
Clifford E. Costley
Audio-Visual Library
Oklahoma City Public Schools
